Login Convergence

Xerox | Co-Design | 2004

Authentication, authorization and accounting (AAA)

Xerox systems have the potential to require several different bits of information to use some of their systems, related to various forms of authentication, access or accounting. Although some customers wanted to utilize more than one method, the volume of user input required made this unusable.

We proposed a design that unified all methods allowing a logical approach to machine access and accounting that is highly coherent and simple to use. By associating authentication names with accounts, and remembering static information, the number of screens and the workflow was significantly improved.

Logical Diagram

Authentication may be required for access to user services, admin tools or both. (Card reader, user input, or other)

Accounting however, may be required on a per job basis, such as charging to a specific client. The user will be prompted at some time before the job is submitted.

The desired state is to associate authenticated users (network login, or card swipe or other) with a specific XSA account. More than one user may be associated with one account.

After the authenticated user first logs in to an Xerox Standard Accounting (XSA) account, the username is thereafter associated with the account and the XSA login will be skipped.

Benefits

  • Multiple datasets (including limits, access, preferences, personalization, metadata, etc.) can be associated with a single login account.
  • Copy limits may be personalized based on user login.
  • User-specific "personal" address books, etc. may be linked to each user.
  • Metadata may be required but now may include user-specific data pre-filled.
